intro: Anthemis garcinii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark brown central disk florets. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sunlight. Anthemis garcinii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
